intro: Diplotaxis × schweinfurthii, commonly known as the African dandelion, is a hybrid plant belonging to the family Brassicaceae. It is characterized by its rosette growth habit and produces yellow flowers that are followed by fluffy, wind-dispersed seeds. The plant is native to southern Africa and is often found in dry, rocky habitats. It has hairy, linear leaves that are adapted to reduce water loss in arid environments. Diplotaxis × schweinfurthii is also known for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional medicine for various purposes.
